alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Briscoe; Castro; Cochran; Floyd; Hale; Hall; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Parmer; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 19 at 2:10PM CST until February 20 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM CST SUNDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHERN SOUTH PLAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE TEXAS SOUTH PLAINS, ROLLING PLAINS, AND EXTREME SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM CST Sunday. a Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. * Timing...11 AM through 7 pm CST both Sunday and again Monday. * Wind...Westerly to southwesterly 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph Sunday and 25 to 35 mph Monday. * Humidity...8 to 15 percent. * Fuels...Critically dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: The Red Flag Warning Sunday means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent. These conditions can create rapid wildfire growth. The Fire Weather Watch Monday means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Monitor later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
